metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11671 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-snapshot - 1:20180425-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gcc-3.3 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-avr package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-msp430 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-snapshot package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:20180425-1ubuntu1').
